item.title: 什么是《芯片法》？特朗普为何要修改它？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战和将制造业带回美国本土的努力将其前任的一项标志性成就推上了风口浪尖：《芯片与科学法案》。【原文：President Donald Trump’s trade war and efforts to bring manufacturing back to US shores have put one of his predecessor’s signature achievements on the firing line: the Chips and Science Act.】

item.title: 中国让孩子们学习制造业以填补工厂工作岗位
item.description:
大学毕业生失业，而数以百万计的蓝领职位仍然空缺。【原文：

College grads are unemployed even as millions of blue-collar positions remain unfilled.

】

item.title: 曼哈顿房屋销售飙升，买家抓住了抵押贷款利率下降的机会
item.description: 曼哈顿的房屋销售在年初表现强劲，因为有更多的购房者选择咬紧牙关，接受较高的抵押贷款利率。【原文：Manhattan home sales had a strong start to the year as a bigger share of buyers chose to bite the bullet and accept elevated mortgage rates.】

item.title: 英国正在努力打击社交诈骗。美国则不然。
item.description:
即将出台的英国法律为如何让网络和消息应用程序加强防御欺诈行为提供了一个测试 。【原文：

Incoming British laws offer a test on how to get networking and messaging apps to beef up defenses against fraud.

】

item.title: 尽管通胀走软，波兰仍将再次维持利率不变
item.description: 波兰央行准备抵制降息压力，因为大多数决策者担心通胀反弹。【原文：Poland’s central bank is poised to resist the pressure to cut interest rates as most policymakers worry about a rebound in inflation.】

item.title: 最低工资上调前英国工人工资增长放缓
item.description: 英国工党政府本周提高了最低工资标准，但对于该国许多低薪工人来说，加薪幅度一直在下降。【原文：Britain’s Labour government hiked the minimum wage this week but for many of the country’s low-paid workers, raises have been on the decline.】

item.title: 新加坡亿万富翁郭氏（Kweks）的 CDL 在发生争吵后受到监管机构质询
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，新加坡城市发展有限公司（City Developments Ltd.）的亿万富翁家族所有者最近发生了一场公开纠纷，之后该公司受到了新加坡证券交易所监管部门的质询。【原文：Singapore’s City Developments Ltd has been questioned by the regulatory arm of the city-state’s stock exchange after a recent public dispute within the billionaire family owner of the developer, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 通胀阴影笼罩日本樱花季
item.description: 樱花在日本各地竞相绽放，引发了一如既往的即兴野餐热潮，但人们在赏花之余经常享用的传统食品价格却在飙升。【原文：Cherry blossoms are in full bloom across Japan, prompting the usual rush of impromptu picnics, but prices are surging for the traditional food items often enjoyed while admiring the flowers.】

item.title: 中国能源局称，中国抑制太阳能过剩的努力效果有限
item.description: 据一份报告称，中国政府和中国太阳能产业采取的一系列措施尚未有效缓解产能过剩问题，预计在2025年的大部分时间里，太阳能电池板的价格仍将保持低位。【原文：A raft of measures by the Chinese government and the nation’s solar industry is yet to meaningfully reduce overcapacity, with the price of panels expected to remain low for most of 2025, according to a report.】

item.title: 僵局加深，中国将中美谈判与取消关税联系起来
item.description: 中国最高外交官呼吁美国在就芬太尼危机举行任何会谈之前，取消因中国政府被指在美国芬太尼危机中扮演的角色而对中国商品征收的关税，这加深了世界两大经济体之间贸易关系的僵局。【原文：China’s top diplomat called on the US to remove tariffs it imposed on Chinese goods for Beijing’s alleged role in America’s fentanyl crisis before holding any talks on the matter, deepening a stalemate weighing on trade ties between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 科德尔科公司将向印度阿达尼冶炼厂输送铜精矿
item.description: 作为世界上最大的铜矿商努力开拓新市场的一部分，Codelco 公司已同意向印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）在印度的冶炼厂供应铜精矿。【原文：Codelco has agreed to supply copper concentrate to Indian billionaire Gautam Adani’s smelter in India, as part of a push by the world’s biggest copper miner to open up new markets.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税开启全球经济风险新时代
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三将宣布一个世纪以来美国最大规模的贸易限制措施，一举颠覆战后的全球贸易体系，并带来难以预测的经济风险。【原文：President Donald Trump on Wednesday is set to announce the most expansive US trade restrictions in a century, at a stroke upending the postwar global trading system and posing difficult-to-predict economic risks.】

item.title: 泰国承诺削减美国贸易顺差，因为它看到 80 亿美元受到冲击
item.description: 泰国承诺通过进口更多能源和食品来缩小对美贸易顺差，据泰国官员估计，如果特朗普政府将关税提高 11%，东南亚国家的出口将受到约 80 亿美元的冲击。【原文：Thailand pledged to narrow its trade surplus with the US by importing more energy and food products, with officials estimating the hit to the Southeast Asian nation’s exports at about $8 billion if the Trump administration raised tariffs by 11%.】

item.title: 现金紧缩缓解可能会支撑印度股票和债券市场
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 高盛选择日元作为抵御美国经济衰退和关税风险的最佳对冲工具
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.）预计，由于美国经济增长和贸易关税引发的不安情绪刺激了对最安全资产的需求，今年日元兑美元汇率将攀升至140的低位。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. expects the yen to climb to the low 140 levels against the dollar this year as jitters around US growth and trade tariffs bolster demand for the safest assets.】

item.title: 沃尔玛在中国政府反击后继续对供应商施加价格压力
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，沃尔玛公司正在继续推动中国供应商降价，以抵消唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税，即使在北京官员上个月召见这家美国零售商的高管讨论这一问题之后也是如此。【原文：Walmart Inc. is continuing to push Chinese suppliers to cut prices to offset President Donald Trump’s tariffs, even after Beijing officials summoned the US retailer’s executives last month to discuss the issue, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁印度受经济放缓影响的汽车零部件制造商
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）即将对全球汽车制造业征收进口关税，本已在国内需求疲软的困境中挣扎的印度汽车零部件制造商，现在又面临着失去其最大海外市场销售的风险。【原文：Indian auto parts makers, already struggling with weak domestic demand, now face the risk of losing sales in their top overseas market as US President Donald Trump’s looming import tariffs ripple through global car manufacturing.】

item.title: 民进党称，考虑到关税和工资问题，日本央行 5 月加息为时尚早
item.description: 一个规模虽小但势力强大的反对党的政策负责人表示，鉴于需要评估将于 4 月初生效的美国关税的影响以及正在进行的工资谈判，日本央行 5 月份加息可能为时过早。【原文：A Bank of Japan rate hike in May would likely be too early given the need to assess the impact of US tariffs set to come into effect in early April and ongoing wage talks, according to the policy chief of a small but powerful opposition party.】

item.title: 日本央行上田称美国关税可能对全球贸易产生重大影响
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，美国的关税可能会对受影响国家的贸易活动产生重大影响，尽管在全球晚些时候正式宣布之前，政策的总体情况目前仍不明朗。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said US tariffs could have a significant impact on trade activity in affected nations, although for now the overall picture of the policies remains unclear ahead of an official announcement later in the global day.】

item.title: 电动汽车撞车事故后小米股价跌幅扩大
item.description: 小米公司证实其一辆电动汽车在中国发生致命事故后，该公司股价周三进一步下跌。【原文：Xiaomi Corp. shares fell further Wednesday after the company confirmed that one of its electric vehicles was involved in a deadly accident in China.】

item.title: 尽管经济放缓，墨西哥仍计划收窄明年财政赤字
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的一系列关税措施即将生效前的几个小时，墨西哥政府宣布将缩小明年的财政赤字，即使经济继续放缓。【原文：Mexico’s government announced that it will narrow the fiscal deficit next year even as the economy continues to slow hours before US President Donald Trump’s battery of tariffs are set to go into effect.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）协议接近尾声，米莱前往特朗普大本营
item.description: 据报道，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊将于周三前往佛罗里达州，在马阿拉歌与唐纳德-特朗普总统举行会谈，因为阿根廷与国际货币基金组织（IMF）新项目的谈判已接近决定性时刻。【原文：President Javier Milei will reportedly travel to Florida on Wednesday for talks with President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago as Argentina’s negotiations for a new International Monetary Fund program near a defining moment.】

item.title: 振动编码 "领导者 Replit 正在洽谈 30 亿美元估值事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，人工智能编码初创公司Replit Inc.正在与投资者洽谈新一轮融资，其估值将提高近两倍，达到30亿美元，这凸显了硅谷投资者对使用人工智能进行软件开发的公司的青睐。【原文：Artificial intelligence coding startup Replit Inc. is in talks with investors for a new funding round that would almost triple its valuation to $3 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring Silicon Valley investors’ appetite for companies using AI for software development.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布加征关税前，黄金坚守在纪录下方
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普实施全面的 "对等 "关税（预计将于周三晚些时候生效）之前，市场从创纪录的上涨中稍事休息，黄金走势平稳。【原文：Gold steadied as the market took a break from a record-setting run ahead of US President Donald Trump’s implementation of sweeping “reciprocal” tariffs, which are expected to take effect later Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行称将提高新公开市场操作回购的价格
item.description: 一位高级官员周三表示，澳大利亚央行将提高所有新公开市场操作回购的价格，并在每周拍卖中引入新的七天期限，以过渡到 "充足储备 "的流动性管理制度。【原文：Australia’s central bank will increase the price of all new open market operation repos and introduce a new seven-day tenor at its weekly auctions as it transitions to an “ample reserves” system for liquidity management, a senior official said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 瑞银集团顶级基金经理称关税可能导致垃圾债券价格便宜
item.description: 一位去年击败98%对手的亚洲垃圾债券投资者说，他 "非常看好 "市场，并准备在其他投资者恐慌时捡便宜。【原文：An Asia junk bond investor who beat 98% of his rivals last year said he is “very bullish” on the market — and ready to pick up bargains if other investors panic.】

item.title: 香港考虑为退市公司建立新的场外股票市场
item.description: 香港正在起草退市股票场外交易市场的规则，目的是让持有越来越多几乎毫无价值的证券的投资者有机会挽回一些损失。【原文：Hong Kong is drafting rules for an over-the-counter market for delisted shares to give investors at risk of owning a growing pile of nearly worthless securities a chance of recouping some losses.】

item.title: 埃克石油有意收购凯雷哥伦比亚资产以增加储量
item.description: 哥伦比亚国有石油公司 Ecopetrol SA 的高层管理人员在接受采访时表示，该公司正在考虑收购凯雷集团在该国的石油钻探公司，以提高储量和产量。【原文：Colombia’s state-owned Ecopetrol SA is considering buying Carlyle Group’s oil driller in the nation as it looks to boost reserves and output, its top executives said in an interview.】

item.title: SmartStop Self Storage REIT 在美国首次公开募股中募集 8.1 亿美元
item.description: SmartStop Self Storage 房地产投资信托公司周二首次公开发行股票，募集资金 8.1 亿美元，股票定价为市场定价范围的下半部分。【原文：SmartStop Self Storage REIT Inc. raised $810 million in an initial public offering Tuesday, pricing its shares in the bottom half of a marketed range.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税计划在玫瑰园活动前仍处于停滞状态
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对征收互惠关税计划的讨论已进入最后阶段，据说他的团队仍在敲定他将于周三下午公布的新征税的规模和范围。【原文：President Donald Trump’s deliberations over his plans to impose reciprocal tariffs are coming down to the wire, with his team said to be still finalizing the size and scope of the new levies he is slated to unveil on Wednesday afternoon.】
